data.title: VHS, Vanderburgh Humane Society
data.text:
Leadership & Administrative Staff

Kendall D. Paul

CEO

Hometown: Evansville, Indiana

Education:

FJ Reitz High School ‘89

B.S. Public Relations, Emphasis in Radio/Television, University of Southern Indiana ‘95

Certificate in Fundraising, Indiana University School of Philanthropy

Leadership Evansville graduate

@VHS: Kendall began her career with the VHS cleaning kennels in 1994. She has since served as the Operations Manager, the Public Relations & Events Manager, and now CEO since 2004. She celebrated 25 years of service to the VHS in 2019.

Pets: 2 dogs, Eleven the Boxer and Dude the Boston Terrier (both VHS alumni); 2 cat, Goose & Samwise (River Kitty Cat Cafe/VHS alumni); and her VHS office pet, Severus Snake the ball python (VHS alum)

Fandoms: Harry Potter, The Walking Dead, Game of Thrones, Star Wars, Lord of the Rings

Favorite Sports Teams: Chicago Cubs & Pittsburgh Steelers

Allison Miller

Business Manager

Hometown: Evansville, IN

Education:

Evansville Day School '99

Indiana Business College

@VHS: Allison joined the VHS Board of Directors in 2016 while working at Banterra Bank. She was a manager of the Evansville Pet Supplies Plus store for 3 years and then joined the VHS as the new Business Manager in March 2021.

Pets: Gus the dog (VHS alum); 3 cats, Oscar (VHS alum), Mogwai, & Eva (VHS alum); Jello the leopard gecko; and 4 aquariums full of fish

Favorite Music: bubblegum pop, classic rock, and the occasional hip hop

Favorite Movies: Pete's Dragon (original); Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory (original); and Pet Sematary (original)

Amanda Coburn

Director of Advancement

Hometown: Evansville, IN

Education:

North High School '08

B.S.B.A. Business Administration & Law, Western Carolina University '11

Leadership Everyone graduate '19

Welborn Baptist Foundation Next Generation Leadership Academy graduate '22

@VHS: Amanda started volunteering with the VHS in 2011 and joined the staff as a part-time events assistant in March 2013. She worked as an Adoption Counselor in 2014 before becoming Development Coordinator in 2015. After a brief departure working at Junior Achievement in 2021, she rejoined the staff in February 2022 as the brand new Director of Advancement.

Pets: 3 cats: Moon, Westley, & Falkor. She also shares her office with Severus Snake the ball python.

Myers-Briggs Personality Type: ENFP

Fandoms: Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings, LOST, Taylor Swift, The Hunger Games

Mackenzee McKittrick

Events & Outreach Coordinator

Hometown: Bowling Green, Indiana

Education:

Clay City High School ‘13

Indiana State University ‘18

@VHS: Mackenzee started volunteering with VHS in 2019. She has spent a total of 8 years fostering and is particularly passionate about neonate and special needs kittens. She joined the team as Events & Volunteer Coordinator in July 2021. In 2023, after the Volunteer Coordinator position became full-time, she took over the VHS' pilot community cat program based on her years of experience with cats/kittens and TNR. She is now the Events & Outreach Coordinator.

Pets: 4 dogs: Teegan, Mortimer, Raider (VHS alum), and Sage; 7 cats (2 with Cerebellar Hypoplasia): Doodle Bob, Tav, Stanky Leg Steve, Huey, Chloe, Jake, & Megamind (6 of 7 are VHS alumni); 2 death feigning beetles, Craig & Larry; and her office pets Leroy the bearded dragon and Cheech the chinchilla.

Hobbies: Hiking, volleyball, fostering, organizing and decorating

Laurie Miller

Development & Public Relations Coordinator

Hometown: Boonville, Indiana

Education:

Castle High School ‘03

University of Evansville ‘18

@VHS: Laurie joined the team in the summer of 2021.

Pets: 4 dogs: Sawyer, Louie, and Odie (all VHS alumni) + Pedro; 2 cats, Egg and Gus. Gone but not forgotten: Showbiz, Chihuahua & best friend for 15 years.

Enneagram Type: 6

Hobbies: RV’ing, hiking, travel, arts and crafts

Wende McKinney

Director of Operations

Hometown: Evansville, IN

Education:

Harrison High School

B.S. Psychology with Concentration in Animal Behavior, Purdue University ’07

@VHS: Wende has been with the VHS since 2008. She has served as Animal Care Technician, Medical/Intakes Supervisor, and was promoted to Assistant Operations Manager in 2009. She became Operations Manager (now titled Director of Operations) in 2016.

Pets: 2 dogs, Sunny & Gidget (VHS alumni); 4 cats, Timmy, Betty, Olaf, & Tilt; and her office pets Gareth the betta fish, Leroy the bearded dragon, and a chinchilla named Cheech

Favorite type of tea: Bubble tea!

Favorite sports team: Chicago Cubs

Amy Hairston

Operations Manager

Hometown: Evansville, IN

Education: Reitz High School

@VHS: Amy rejoined the VHS staff in 2019 as the Assistant Operations Manager. Her total time working at VHS, previously + currently, is more than 12 years!

Pets: 2 dogs, Oscar & Lolli; 4 cats, Kittaly, Eddie, Luna, & Jimmy; 1 gerbil, Creature; and office pets Gareth the betta fish, Leroy the bearded dragon, and a chinchilla named Cheech.

If you were a dog, what breed would you be? A mutt! :)

Favorite type of tea: Chai tea

Cyndi Hoon Donley

Humane Education Coordinator

Hometown: Bedford, IN

Education:

Bedford-North Lawrence High School ‘80

B.A. Telecommunications & Theater, Indiana University ‘84

@VHS: Cyndi began volunteering as a docent at VHS in 1995. She was asked to join the VHS team in 2003 and now splits her time between Humane Education and working the front desk.

Pets: 1 dog, Joey the Golden Retriever (VHS alum). (In loving memory of Fiona the Golden Retriever, pictured above, who was a beloved part of the VHS Humane Education team for more than 10 years and passed away August 1, 2020.)

Favorite Bands: The Beatles and Led Zeppelin

Favorite Ice Cream Flavor: Cherry Amaretto

Diane Whipkey

Thrift Store Coordinator

Hometown: Evansville, IN

Education:

Harrison High School ‘65

West Side Beauty College

@VHS: Diane has dedicated nearly her entire adult life to the VHS’ cause. Her mother was a long-time volunteer until her passing in 1997. Diane carries on her legacy today and has served as a volunteer, Board Member from 1982-2004, and staff member from 2004-present.

Pets: 1 dog, Hazel the Happy Tails Resale Shop mascot (VHS alum) 1 cat, Bengal (VHS alum.) In loving memory of Ms. Wiggles Whipkey, the wiggly pit bull in the photo above who was the Happy Tails Resale Shop "canine CEO" and passed away in May 2021.

Favorite Movie: Dances with Wolves

If you were a dog, what breed would you be? An American Staffordshire Terrier (“pit bull”) of course!

Vanessa Brown

Foster Care Coordinator

Hometown: Evansville, IN

Education:

Reitz High School & Signature School

@VHS: Vanessa originally joined the VHS team in 2011. After a year away, she rejoined the organization in 2016. She has served in a variety of animal care roles, and most recently accepted the Foster Care Coordinator position in February 2021.

Pets: 3 dogs, Zoey the pit mix, Taffy the Puggle mix, & Scotty the Chihuahua mix; and 2 cats, Jack Action and Palley. All are VHS alumni.

Favorite Music: Elle King, Kacey Musgraves, & 90's country

Favorite Books: Too many to choose! Lately, true crime books (and podcasts.)

Alana Fligor

Volunteer Coordinator

Hometown:

Education:

@VHS:

Pets: None right now!

Favorite band(s):

Hobbies:

Doug Sims

Facilities Technician

(photo coming soon)

Hometown:

Education:

@VHS: Doug joined the VHS team in early 2020.

Pets: None right now!

Favorite band(s):
